attributes.action: Prevent the proposed cut of humanitarian aid to Yemen
attributes.additional_details: 2 million Yemeni children are  acutely malnourished, and 20 million Yemeni people depend on aid. The UN chief described cutting aid as a 'death sentence'. The government says COVID has squeezed government finances - the proposed cut of £87m is relatively small for the UK, but invaluable for Yemen.
attributes.background: Parliament has committed 0.7% of GDP to aid budgets since 2013, but this was recently slashed to 0.5%. Yemen desperately needs aid - the current government has undermined British aid by merging DFID and the FCO, and now threatens lives by cuts. I beg this government to show some compassion.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577527
